title: Opening Ceremony
people: PRK , Chris Creagh, Marianne De Pierres, Kathleen Griffiths, Kitty Hemsley, Brendan Ragan, Brandon Sanderson
description:
Let's kick this apocalypse off in style!
Come meet our fantastic guests and find out what's planned for the weekend.

title: Wii Sports Resort
description: Come play Wii Sports Resort! There is over 30 sports like activities to choose from.

title: Pokemon Stadium mini game fun
description: Compete in a series of mini games as your favorite Pokemon to become the mini games champion. Both stadium 1 and 2 mini games will be played in four tournament rounds and two final rounds.

title: Street Fighter IV
description: Fight for the future and title of best fighter. The Super and Arcade versions will be used.

title: Forza 4 Time Trials
description: Place times in the fastest cars in the world on the best tracks including Top Gear's test track. If you manage to beat the Stig's time, you might get a prize :)

title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Survival Challenge
description: Make your way through the toughest challenges a modern FPS has to offer. The aim of the game...Survive as long as you can and reach goal points.

title: Halo: Reach tournament
description: Halo fans, now is your chance to enter a all out tournament to see who is the best. Don't miss this event as it's going to be big!

title: Soul Calibur 4 and 5
description: Soul Edge and Soul Calibur return in the continuing fighting game series Soul Calibur 5. A tournament will be held from 15:00 to 16:00.

title: Golden Eye Tournament
description: 007, or which ever agent you are. Your mission if you choose to accept it is to kill everyone as many times as possible! Both N64 and Wii versions will be available to play.

title: Star Wars Pod racing
description: Feeling nostalgic? Feeling like playing sometime Star Wars and classic? well, it's time to race again in the fastest pods around. The version is the old N64 classic.

title: Lylat Wars
description: Team Star Fox comes to Doomcon in the game that put the Star fox characters into the great classics. Play as Fox, Peppy, Slippy or Falco in a battles to see who is the best in the team. Those with 3DSs may wish to come along and have a tournament as well.

title: Fable III co-op time trials
description: Reaver has issued a challenge to all of you heroes out there. He wants you to spin the wheel of misfortune and battle in his arenas. The heroes with the highest score wins.

title: Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3
description: Doom! Doom! Doom! Doctor Doom that is. For the first event of Saturday's console stream, it's time to decide which universe is the winner. Help decide and support ether Marvel or Capcom.

title: Blur racing
description: To sum up Blur in a nut shell, it's Mario Kart with real cars, slightly different power ups and courses based on real places. Come have some multi-player fun!

title: Blur Destruction
description: The Blur awesomeness continues, but in a different mode! Just like in Mario Kart, there's a brawl mode where your goal is to take out the other racers with power ups. The racer with the most points wins.

title: Super Smash Brothers Brawl Tournament
description: Play as your favorite Nintendo characters, in a fun, beat everyone up, kind of game. This is a major tournament in Doomcon so don't miss it!

title: Mario Kart
description: Still feeling hyped after Smash Bros Brawl? Well now it's time for Mario Kart! Another game where you have the chance to play as one of your favorite Mario series character. Race through 2 different cups to see who is the fastest.

title: Pokemon Battle Revolution
description: Pokemon Trainers! Bring your DS and Pokemon games, because it's time to battle it out on the big screen. See your team in action in better detail than your DS gives you as well as getting commentary too.

title: BlazBlue
description: A fighting game that now is a manga and anime, This anime fighting game is one of the most popular in Japan. See how you go in this arcade style fighting game.

title: Tekken 7
description: Well, it's the 7th of April, so why not have a tournament of Tekken 7. So come and fight to become the champion of the corporate world.

title: Dynasty Warriors 7
description: Play in the era of the 3 waring nations of China. The challenge, to see how big you can make your KO count.

title: Portal Time Trials
description: See how far you can get in the Portal games. There are competitions for both Portal 1 single player and Portal 2 single player.

title: Portal 2 Co-op Time Trials
description: See how far you and a friend can get in the cooperative time trials. There's also a secret individual scoring system so remember that your friend is also a rival.

title: Hand Held Console Fun-o-rama
description: Bring your DS, PSP and iphones for a get together of multi-player fun hand held gaming. Mario Kart, Pokemon, Bomberman, Starfox and FF:Dissidia will be the main games played.

title: Left 4 Dead 2 Survival
description: The world is at a zombie infested end as we know it. Play as the Survivors with 3 other people and see how long it takes before your all dead.

title: Initial D arcade racing
description: Play the popular Japanese racing game Initial D Extreme stage. A proper arcade kit will be setup for this event so come and see how well you do.

title: Scott Pilgrim vs. The World Time Trials
description: Play as the awesome characters from Scott Pilgrim vs. the world. It's up to you and 3 others to go through the game as fast as possible within a time limit.

title: Mario Party 8
description: Mario Party 8 is a fun board game style Mario game where the aim is to collect stars and win mini games. Come along if you want some great late night fun.

title: Assassin's Creed Tournament
description: It's time to find out if your the best assassin. Compete in a series of matches where the goal is to out kill each other. A prize is available for best/funniest death.

title: Open Console gaming
description: Feel like doing something besides the masquerade? Feel like gaming with friends? Then come join us for some open console gaming fun and play the games you want to play!

title: Open Console gaming
description: Come play console games! play what you feel like playing, and see what video gaming has to offer. This is also the perfect chance to play a game you've been thinking of buying to see if you still do.

title: Rockband
description: Want to be a Sing, rock star or drummer? And play your favorite songs? Then here's your chance. Feel free to come down, enjoy the music and sing along.

title: DDR
description: Come play Dance Dance Revolution. That's right, we've got the actual arcade machine! so come over and have some arcade dancing action!

title: Grey Goo and Home-made Atomic Bombs: How Hackerspaces will cause the Apocalypse!
people: Brett Downing, Jenna Downing, Daniel Harmsworth
description:
These crazy mad-scientist types making rail guns, plasma speakers and artificially engineered microbes are going to cause the Apocalypse!

How can we stop them?

Should we?

title: Science fiction relating to real science
people: Chris Creagh, Rob Masters, Elaine Walker, Andrew Williams
description: Is Science fiction useful when trying to communicate scientific ideas. Does it inspire or does it create unrealistic expectations of science?

title: Exploring Dr Who: The Most Recent Season
people: Michael Cogan, Aaron Creaser, Damian Magee, Heather Magee
description:
'The Truth about River Song': In the sixth season  River Song was revealed,  how did the Doctor know
the truth about River and about Amy? As the panellists go through this unfolding story of love, relationships, trust and secrets all will
be revealed  
or  
Are bow ties really cool?

title: The Wheel of Time
description:
The Wheel of Time turns, and Ages come and pass, leaving memories that become legend.

Legend fades to myth, and even myth is long forgotten when the Age that gave it birth comes again.

First published by Robert Jordan in 1990, The Eye of the World presented fans with a rich and vibrant fantasy world which continues to enthral over 20 years later, despite Jordan's untimely death in 2007.

Selected to complete the Wheel of Time, Brandon Sanderson has published two volumes so far, and is working on the final volume, A Memory of Light, due in early 2013. Join Brandon Sanderson and several Wheel of Time fans as they discuss the impact this series has had.

title: Writing in someone else's sandbox
people: Stephen Dedman, Paul Kidd, Brandon Sanderson
description: What is it like being asked to write for someone else? How do you go about doing it in a way that is true to the author and respectful to the fans?

title: Beneath the Iron Lady
description: How was SF shaped by Thatcherite England? We look at such works as Watchmen, V for Vendetta and Warhammer.

title: Buffy Apocalypses
description:
Buffy regularly saves the residents of Sunnydale from the horror of the Hellmouth, but often she saved the entire world from a supernatural apocalypse

Have your say on which apocalypse rated the highest in this interactive panel!

title: Life on Mars & Ashes to Ashes - What did it all mean?
description:
_Life on Mars_ and _Ashes to Ashes_. Sam Tyler and Alex Drake went on two wondrous, anxious and at times confusing journeys. We attempt to come to some sort of conclusion about what it all means...

There will be Spoilers, you have been warned!

title: Outland Screening & Discussion
description:
Thanks to ABC, we're able to screen episode 1 and 2 of Outland! If you haven't had a chance to see this fantastic new show, now is the time! 

After the screening there'll be fun, discussion, and prizes. Don't miss out!

title: The science of Crime TV
description: What do shows like CSI and Law and Order get wrong? What do they do right? The Crime Scene Committee will tell ius all about it!

title: Avatar: The Last Airbender - Why was it so successful?
description: What makes The Last Airbender Cartoon Series so eminently watchable

title: 2011 in Film - Part 1
people: Tina Eitelhuber, Tom Eitelhuber, Ju Landéesse
description: 2011 delivered a bounty of genre cinema, spanning sci-fi, fantasy, comic book films, horror and more. Our panel of movie buffs will sift through the year's releases and try to separate the good from the bad and the bad from the just plain awful. Hear their verdicts and contribute your own!

title: Anne McCaffrey: An Appreciation
people: Ian Nicholls, Sarah Parker, Zoe Wadsworth
description: Over her 60 year career, Anne McCaffrey provided the SF community with intricate worlds and thrilling stories. We remember the things that made her great, and discuss why she continues to be an influence in SF.

title: Shoujo and Josei - Anime for women
description: We talk about boys anime a lot – why don’t we talk about GIRLS anime

title: 6 Degrees of Kevin Bacon
people: Tina Eitelhuber, Tom Eitelhuber, David Gunn, Tori K, David Thatcher
description: The "Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon" meme states that every actor can be linked with Kevin Bacon through his or her film roles in 6 or fewer steps. We've taken that premise and turned it into a movie trivia quiz show! Which of our four contestants will walk away with the Bacon Trophy? (note: actual Bacon Trophy may not exist)

title: Romero Retrospective
description:
Spanning 3 decades, Romero's Zombie trilogy _Night of the Living Dead_, _Dawn of the Dead_, _Day of the Dead_ are widely regarded as the most influential Zombie films of all time.

Come and Revisit the horror!

title: Sanderson's First Law
description:
Sanderson's first law is "Magic/technology has well defined rules that the audience understands. As a result, one can use this to solve conflict more easily as the capabilities are cleanly defined."

How do we go about creating a magic system like this?

title: Trailer Park
people: Tom Eitelhuber, Tom Eitelhuber, David Gunn
description: Is the american film industry running out of new ideas? Join us as we watch trailers and discuss upcoming films.

title: Exploring The Hunger Games
description:
_The Hunger Games_ is a series that has taken the world by storm. Set in a dystopian North America, it explores the shocking possibilities when battle royale and reality television combine. 

What is it about this world, and this story, that makes us want more?

title: Learn to Play Magic: The Gathering
description: Come discover the wonder that is Magic the gathering. Our expert panel will play games with the audience to show them how it's supposed to work

title: Final Landing: The End of The Shuttle Era
description:
The world was changed when, in 1969, a human first walked on the moon. The US Manned Space program ran from the late 1960s to 2011, and in that time launched many people into space and performed countless research tasks.

Now the program has come to an end, with Atlantis making its final landing in July 2011. What has the world gained since the program first launched? And what have we lost now that it has ended?

title: The rise of Transformative-media
tags: Comics, Panel Discussion, Screen, Video Gaming
description:
In recent years many different works has given rise to there ‘universe’ been translated into different media formats.

Games have spawned books and short films. TV series have been given comic book editions. What are some of the best examples and what makes them either successful or an unwanted accompaniment to the original?

title: Eschatology and Apocalypticism across time and space
description:
Eschatology is a part of theology, philosophy, and futurology concerned with what are believed to be the final events of history, the ultimate destiny of humanity — commonly referred to as the end of the world. 

Not all of these end of the world scenarios have their roots in Christianity. Some of them are much, much older. Come and learn about other ways the world might end.

title: My Little Pony: from the 80s to Today
people: Leah Crichton, Adam McCaw, Samara Morgan
description: The new incarnation of My Little Pony has attracted a new demographic. What has changed? Is this change good or bad? What is it about both versions that we love and hate?

title: Welcome to the Laundry: The Horror/Spy works of Charles Stross
people: Bronwyn Cropley, John Parker, Andrew Sharp
description: In a universe where advanced mathematics are truly indistinguishable from magic, and a badly designed Fractal Generator can threaten to rend all space time, all that stands between us and the madness beyond the veil are a bunch of geeky petty bureaucrats trapped in the ultimate dead end civil service job. Welcome to the Laundry, where "Bob" (Not his real name) will try and fight off non-euclidean horrors and (more terrifyingly) middle management, and, (if he gets time) finally audit the department for compliance with their NT 4 licensing.

title: Mass Effect 3, What's with That Ending?
people: Jess Colwill, Tim Colwill, Stephen Griffiths, Andrew Hahn, Amy Hightower
description:
THIS PANEL *WILL* CONTAIN SPOILERS

There's a lot of complaints about the ending of Mass Effect 3 - where exactly did they go wrong and why?

title: Video Games: How the Sausage Gets Made - Part 1
people: Jack Casey, Wesley Lamont, Aranda Morrison, Anthony Sweet
description: How does a video game get started? what happens before you hire a lot of people?

title: Video Games: How the Sausage Gets Made - Part 2
people: Aranda Morrison, Garth Pendergrast, Anthony Sweet
description:
So we've figured out the process for our game (we hope) but what crops up during production?

All this pipeline stuff is all well and good, but how does this eventually get paid for?

title: Writing content for Video Games
tags: Craft of Writing, Panel Discussion, Video Gaming
description:
What can fiction writers contribute to video game projects?
What translates well and what doesn't, from written to video game?

title: Lost Girl: Sexy without being Sexist?
people: Tori K, Ju Landéesse, Kendra Swaine
description: How does Lost Girl manage to be sexy while avoiding the usual sexist traps? Is it just the Man Candy? Camera angles? All of the above?

title: Whatever happened to the fourth Wall?
people: Kathleen Griffiths, Kitty Hemsley, Adam McCaw
description:
Supernatural, My Little Pony, Sherlock Holmes: Game of Shadows.

What happens when fan service goes too far?  The creators of these shows have all been influenced by their fans. How has this affected storytelling?

title: Mad Science vs. Mystic Powers
description: Dr. Vellocet and Master Demens Caput debate (without using their equipment) the best way to end the world.

title: BEEFCAKE!!!
description: Man Candy! We Love it! Come talk about it!

title: Kitty Pryde is Awesome!
description: Beginning as the ultimate Kid Sister, Kitty Pryde has gone on to become one of the most-loved Marvel characters of all time. Two of the biggest Kitty Pryde fans will discuss her start, her development, and what it is about her that makes her so great.

title: EscherGirls: from Rob Liefeld to J. Scott Campbell
people: Tori K, Tori K, Nancy Lorenz
description:
Some comic artists are great at drawing women in poses that are anatomically impossible, "Eschergirls" is a tumblr dedicated to these creations.

We discuss egregious examples and why specific artists tend to do it.

title: This moment for women in comics
people: Kitty Hemsley, Tori K, Nancy Lorenz
description: We know what is wrong with the treatment of women in comics. Lets look at some ways people are getting it right.

title: Welcome to Swancon - Newbie Panel
people: Samara Morgan, Sarah Parker, Shay Telfer
description: Hi, be welcome among us.

title: NaNoWriMo Dos and Don'ts
description: NaNoWriMo is one of the biggest challenges a new writer can face: write a 50,000 word story in only 30 days! Learn from experienced NaNoWriMers all the highs and lows, and what to do once the month is over.

title: A Sense of Immersion
people: Marianne De Pierres, Bevan McGuiness, Brandon Sanderson
description: How to use prose to trigger the senses and make your world easy to fall into.

title: Rewriting the Manuscript
people: Satima Flavell, Elaine Kemp, Carol Ryles
description: Finishing a manuscript is just the first step. Once you have the rough copy in your hands, what is the next step in making it a publishable work?

title: What Do You Owe Your Reader?
people: Marianne De Pierres, Stephen Dedman, Brandon Sanderson
description: A book does not end with it's publication: the process continues when fans read and disect your work. What effect should the reader have on the timing, structure, or even plot of a story?

title: Beyond Potter and Twilight
people: Gina Goddard, Sally Hemsley, James Morgan
description: Harry Potter and Twilight are very successful Young Adult books, where does one go from these series?

title: Gender Norms in Fiction
people: Marianne De Pierres, Elaine Kemp, Bevan McGuiness, Brandon Sanderson
description:
Gender diversity is about more than adding a Strong Female Character. To truly have diversity you must represent a spectrum of different genders, sexualities and gender representations. 
How do you properly write believable and diverse characters across the gender and sexuality spectrum?

title: Anti-Zombie Slingshots, Pig Iron Battle-Axes and Open Source Hardware: How Hacker-Spaces will help us survive the Apocalypse
people: Brett Downing, Jenna Downing, Daniel Harmsworth

title: Australian Censorship - Broken Beyond Repair?
people: Dave Cake, Cathy Cupitt, Amy Hightower
description:
The Australian Censorship system currently requires all games released in australia to be submitted to the OFLC for classification and yet there are thousands of unclassified games available via Apple's iTunes store, the Android store, the internet and Steam.

There are different censorship regimes for Books, Film, TV, Games and the Internet - but isn't the Internet ultimately going to deliver all of this content? 

Is the Australian Censorship system broken beyond repair, or are there avenues we can take to patch the system?

title: The Privacy Apocalypse?
people: Dave Cake, Wing Chung, Peter Hannay
description:
Is privacy dead? 

People are sharing all sorts of personal information via social networking sites. Google is paying us to watch all our traffic and laws don't seem to be able (or interested?) in catching up.

Have we permanently traded away Privacy for Convenience?

title: Red Dwarf: Did something go wrong?
people: Llew Bendsten, David Gunn, Mel Kosick-McCaw
description:
Red Dwarf is a hilarious sit-com style Sci-Fi show which has run since 1988. What made this show become the cult-classic it is today?

Listen to passionate fans discuss the highs and lows of their favourite series.

title: 2013 Homework
people: Amber Boyatzis, Andrew Sharp, Zoe Wadsworth
description: Now you know 2013's guests, you can find out what you should read!

title: Star Trek vs. Star Wars - The Ultimate Debate
people: Sarah Akers, Stefen Brazulaitis, Kaneda Cruz, Gina Goddard, Ian Nicholls
description:
William Shatner and Carrie Fisher started it and we debate it. 

The ultimate battle. Who will win?

Rumors that George Takei will be attending this panel are completely false

title: Oh Doctor, My Doctor
description: Every fan has a favourite Doctor.  Perhaps the Doctor you saw first, the one you like the most or the one in the stories you most like.  Or perhaps the Doctor associated with your favourite companion. Come along and join a lively discussion to talk about “Your” Doctor, 1-11. (or perhaps it’s Joanna Lumley ?)

title: Colonising Mars
people: Wesley Lamont, Rob Masters, Sha Sharp, Andrew Williams
description: Colonising Mars has long been a dream of Spec Fic enthusiasts, but how realistic is it really? Listen to experts discuss what is feasible and what is flawed.

title: Poi Twirling Workshop
description:
Poi involves swinging tethered weights through a variety of rhythmical and geometric patterns. It is an art form that can be done with lights, fire, even a pair of rolled up socks!

Think you've got what it takes? Come along and learn the basics of poi!

title: Sherlock - Comparing the different versions
people: Chris Gorham, Matt Holmes, Damian Magee, Zoe Wadsworth
description: Sherlock Holmes is a rich vein of fiction that keeps being revisitng. Our talented team of panelists goes through a few and tells us what it is that makes these stories timeless.

title: The Secrets Of Fringe
description: JJ Abrahm's latest TV series is amazing. What is it about this show that makes it better than the rest?

title: Model Rocketry - Beyond watching it go up
description: With the advent of cheap(ish) sensors and microcontrollers, we can do a lot more with model rocketry. Daniel will tell us what and share war stories!

title: Arduino U: Programming Tiny Computers
description:
A two hour introduction into programming your own tiny computer.

Bring a laptop and we'll provide the rest!

title: Neat things you can do with tiny (and cheap!) computers
description: Now there are very easily accessible microcontrollers, but what can you do with them? Come and see some wonderful props, robotics and a musical instrument - all done with Arduinos and other cheap computing devices!

title: What happens after I finish the Manuscript?
tags: Business of Writing, Craft of Writing
description:
There's more to getting a book on the shelves (or on your Kindle) than just handing in that manuscript.

What's the process involved beyond the manuscript submission? What kinds of people are involved and how long do they spend?

title: Fairy Tales Today
description: Once Upon A Time, Grimm, Snow and the Huntsman... It seems that our screens have been inundated with modern retellings of fairy tales. What is their appeal? How long will they stay around?

title: Halfling Heist - Handwritten Games Sneak Preview
tags: Board Game, Gaming, Handwritten Games, Sneak Preview
description:
Special Swancon Sneak Preview:

Halfling Heist is a fast-paced board game that pits you up against three other Halfling thieves attempting to snaffle the served meals of the Cockatrice Corral while it’s punters have a brief round of fisticuffs. It’s your job to snatch as much food as possible and scarper before the City Watch shut the venue and catch you red-handed with someone else’s chicken sandwich.
 
It’s quick, fun and brutal as you dodge the barroom brawl and try to outgrab and outscore your fellow Halflings. The more hits you take, the more Luck you’ll get - just make sure you get out in time to enjoy your meal!

Everyone who plays going into a raffle to win a copy of Halfling Heist

title: Halfling Heist - The Second Opportunity - Handwritten Games Sneak Preview
tags: Card Game, Gaming, Handwritten Games, Sneak Preview
description:
Special Swancon Sneak Preview:

Halfling Heist is a fast-paced board game that pits you up against three other Halfling thieves attempting to snaffle the served meals of the Cockatrice Corral while it’s punters have a brief round of fisticuffs. It’s your job to snatch as much food as possible and scarper before the City Watch shut the venue and catch you red-handed with someone else’s chicken sandwich.
 
It’s quick, fun and brutal as you dodge the barroom brawl and try to outgrab and outscore your fellow Halflings. The more hits you take, the more Luck you’ll get - just make sure you get out in time to enjoy your meal!

Everyone who plays going into a raffle to win a copy of Halfling Heist

title: Solitare for Two - Ancient Board Games for Two People
description:
Woken up unnaturally early for a Swancon?

Desperate for a game but can only find one other person?

Then come to the Gaming Room and try your hand at the popular two-player games of centuries past.

Games include:
- Fox and Geese
- Nine Mens Morris
- Tigers and Goats
- Sennet

title: Future of Learning
people: Daniel Harmsworth, Elaine Kemp, Bevan McGuiness, Ian Nicholls
description:
MIT is now running a free accredited course on electronics and circuits.

Kahn Academy is trying to provide the net-using world free educational videos.

How is this changing the face of learning?

title: Alternate Realities - Are we running to or from?
description:
We have a history of creating alternate realities through our fiction or for our entertainment.

Do we do this to run from reality or to create a new reality?

title: I Love a Battlefield in the Early Morning - Fairy Chess
description:
Your eyes open and its early, real early. Luckily it is never too early for a good game of chess.

But since it is so early, you find the game is curiously screwed...into Fairy Chess.

No, not actual fairys, jeez, this are chess variations of strangeness and interest.

Includes:
- Pawns Revolt
- Monochrome
- Suicide
Plus the not so chess alternatives of checkers and backgammon...and sure, if you are being, well, main stream, normal chess

title: Technology - it's all about porn!
description: Can the development of technology really be mapped to humanities' love of naked bodies? What is it about porn that pushes us beyond our technological limits?

title: Me, Myself and that Random Guy - Geeky Games for Two or More People
description:
Its the first morning of the convention and you are excited and awake and...oh, you need some people to game with...

Come to the Gaming Room and you will find a whole set of two player and more games to start your con the proper way...evil scheming and doing anything to win.

Games include:
- Cathedral
- Othello
- Pentaro
- Tau
- Magblast
- Agricola
- 7th Wonder
And more

title: Go Fish - Two player and more early morning card games
description:
Competition is good for the soul and you have a great advantage, 'cause at this time of the day, your opponent is sleepy.

Card games for one, two and more people

title: Only You Can Save the Universe! - A Cthulu LARP Event
description:
The World is in deep, deep danger but it's okay, the greatest magician in the world has a plan and all he needs is the cooperation of the world's best magicians. 

If we all work together, we can do it...right?

It's like herding cats. 

What was that formula again - "Save the Cheerleader, Save the..." hang on, hang on...that is not quite right.

Come and Play in a Live Action Role-Play in the Cthulhu Universe

title: "Nerd" Music you may not have heard
description:
From Chap-Hop to Nerdcore, Music about invading zombies, classical remixes of video game themes, bands featured in video games 

We'll show you a whole bunch of cool stuff!

title: Building a Post-Apocalyptic World
people: Marianne De Pierres, Sue Isle, Brandon Sanderson
description: Whether it is a part of this world or a creation of something entirely new, post-apocaytic worlds need to be believable to draw the reader in. What are some of the ways you can build this world and make it convincing enough to ensnare your readers?

title: Apocalyptic Portrayals in Screen media
people: Stephen Dedman, Stephen Griffiths, Andrew Sharp
description: Movies have often shown us different end of the world scenarios. We take a few of our favourites and compare and contrast. Which ones stand up to scrutiny?

title: Apocalyptically Bad Science
description: There's some exceptionally poor science in apocalyptic films - The Day After Tomorrow, Volcano and The Core just to name a few. Let's mock them!

title: Post-Apocalyptic Fashion
people: Sarah Akers, DC Daines, Coreynn Tan
description: Gas mask chique, military corsets, anti-radiation gowns; what will you be wearing after the world ends?

title: Apocalypse Now: Has the apocalypse begun?
people: Chris Creagh, Cass Edwards, Daniel Harmsworth
description: Global Warming, peak energy, peak oil... Are we already heading towards the apocalypse?

title: The end of General Purpose Computing
description:
Cory Doctorow delivered a keynote speech at the 28th Chaos Computer Congress about how General Purpose computing is both dangerous and threatening to to powers that be and as a result will be banned.

Should we be concerned about this or is it all fear mongering? What harms could general purpose computing cause?

title: Preparing for the Apocalypse
description: A sober look at how to prepare your bug out kit, bunker or transportation for the Apocalypse

title: Comics: Where should I start?
description: A group of dedicated comics fans - both old and new - are here to tell you how to begin your comic-reading journey

title: Quidditch for Muggles
description:
Muggles have always longed to play Quidditch, yet despite all our efforts the brooms just don't work!

It is discrimination, people.

So stuff it, lets play anyway!

Fast moving fun for the young and otherwise inclined

title: Shiver Me Timbers - An Sailing Ship Obstacle Course
description:
Come sail with me, come sail through these rather twisty paths.

We have a PLAN

1. Build a ship of paper and origami skills

2. Navigate the ship through the deadly maze of obstacles using the power of your own breath

3. Cheat as much as possible

4. Win the Race and Gloat over everyone else

title: Battle of the High Seas
description:
For as long as man can remember, the Zombie Fleets have pillaged the sea and all have cowered in fear.

But now a Navy has been created to fight the scourge.

Choose your side - will you fight for money and power or for the forces of Good and Right?

It's your choice

title: From manuscript to Ebook
tags: Business of Writing, Literature, Real World
people: Paul Kidd, Alisa Krasnostein, Amanda Rainey
description:
_"it's just copy and paste right?"_ 

No it's not. 

Our local experts discuss the trials and tribulations involved in producing Ebooks.

title: Firefly Retrospective
description: It's been 10 years since Firefly. Let's look back.

title: What's On In Perth
description: What can you go to other than Swancon? Presenters from the various organisations in Perth will tell you all about why you should be attending their events.

title: Zombie Bus
people: Alex Dawson, Daniel Harmsworth, Trent Lloyd
description: Survival after the zombie apocalypse is impossible without a well-equipped anti-zombie vehicle. How do you make your car zombie proof?

title: Spec-Fic For Small Ones
people: Gina Goddard, Anna Hepworth, Damian Magee, Sandra Norman
description:
Turning the next generation into geeks isn't always easy. You need to know not only which shows and books are appropriate, but which ones your children will be interested in. 

Listen to our panelists discuss some of the ways we can encourage and promote speculative fiction to kids.

title: Dr Who - Are You New?
people: Kathleen Griffiths, Nancy Lorenz, Heather Magee
description:
Eccleston, Tennant and Matt Smith have brought great new twists to one of the most enduring science fiction protagonists of all time. For some fans, this was their first introduction to the iconic character. 

But the old series has a lot to offer fans as well. Our panelists discuss what it is about the old series that they love, and what will appeal to new fans of Doctor Who.

title: Smallworld & Underworld Come and Play - 1pm to 3pm
description:
This world is just not big enough for all of us...you really should leave.

I came into this world and called it, This World...and then I met the other guys. They are in my way.

Spawn a race, spread across the land and get rid of the irritating pests in the way. 

 Now with the Underworld Expansion Game and Tunnels to connect the worlds together

title: Paranormal Romance
tags: Adult Only, Panel Discussion, Urban Fantasy
people: PRK , Theresa Anns, Ju Landéesse, Sarah Parker
description: Our panellists discuss the blurring line between fantasy and romance, plus their takes on the best and worstbest and worst of Paranormal Romance and why they love it, hate it and/or skip the sex scenes. Please bring your own alcohol, as our panellists certainly will! Please note - this is an Adults Only panel.

title: For Love Or Bromance
tags: Adult Only, Panel Discussion, Urban Fantasy
people: Kathleen Griffiths, Kitty Hemsley, Tori K
description: From Supernatural to Merlin; hot guys and their platonic love for each other.

title: Arkham Horror
description:
Something is wrong in the town of Arkham for tonight is the night that the gates to the other worlds open. 

There are monsters on the street and horror in the darkness.

It is up to one group of investigators to find a way to stop the Great Old One from manifesting and destroying us all.

Good luck, you are going to need it.

title: Brandon Sanderson - Guest of Honour Speech
description:
Our International Guest of Honour, Brandon Sanderson, writes in many post apocalyptic worlds, including his renowned Mistborn series, Elantris, Warbreaker, Stormlight Archive and Wheel of Time series, which is his finishing off after Robert Jordan's untimely death.
Come listen to Brandon as he talks about his journey into writing, and the worlds he writes in.

title: Marianne de Pierres - In conversation
description: Zoe Wadsworth interviews Marianne de Pierres, our National Guest of Honour. Topics may or may not include how and why Marianne became a writer, writing in different genres, publishing under different pseudonyms, balancing writing and raising a family, and the fine art of galah wrangling.

title: Chris Creagh - In Conversation
description:
Chris, our Fan Guest of Honour, first attended Swancon in 1999 and has been a strong and supportive member of the fan community for many years, being recognised with a MumFan Award in 2009.
Come and join Chris as she chats about a range of topics including fandom, science, sustainability, and the intersection of all three.

title: How to run a Swancon
people: PRK , Tom Eitelhuber, Anna Hepworth, Rohan Wallace
description: So, you're wondering how the magic happens - how does a SwanCon come together? It all starts with an idea (and not always a good one!). Deciding you'd like to run a SwanCon is the easy part. How do you get from that initial idea, to a successful bid and finally to a convention? Learn from our panel of previous and current SwanCon committee members.

title: Safe Spaces
description: A frank and in-depth discussion about the creation of Safe Spaces: their uses, why they're needed and how they work.

title: Skipping the Apocalypse: Cryonics
description: If death is the worst thing that can happen to you, how do a few dozen years in the fridge rate? Are the risks of the thaw outweighed by the benefits of medical advances? What are your chances of being thawed out and reanimated, and what are the consequences of "death" not being the final frontier?

title: The Great Steampunk Affaire!
description:
Dr Vellocet advertises the next GSPA and tells us why you should “Journey From The Centre Of The Perth” to their next Jules-Vernian speleological-spectacular 
immersive steampunk theatre-ball at Cabaret Cave on April 28. 

Talk includes full Engineering Diagrams of The Mole.

title: Steampunk Costuming
people: Sarah Akers, Kendra Swaine, Coreynn Tan
description:
How does a cove become a chap and respected in the steampunk community?

These panelists will show you how!

title: Non 'dane in a Mundane World
people: Kitty Hemsley, John Parker, Kendra Swaine
description:
It's not all foam rubber swords, water pistols - leaving our fandom specific group, the way we choose to live often causes people to react in ways that are less than respectful. 

How do you deal with the mundane world's social constructs?

title: The DC Apocalypse: How did that go for them?
people: Kris Bather, Chris Gorham, Amy Hightower, Zoe Wadsworth
description:
On the 31st of August 2011, DC relaunched their entire line. It's now been 8 months 

# How did that go for them?
# Why did it work (or not?)
# What did they do right? 
# What did they do wrong?

title: Awards Ceremony
description: Tin Duck Awards

title: A Song of Ice and Fire
people: Adam Bodestyne, Stephen Dedman, Matt Holmes
description:
"A Game of Thrones", the first novel in George RR Martin's "A Song of Ice and Fire", was first published in 1991. Although originally intended as a trilogy, the series now holds 5 novels and 3 prequel novellas, with more novels planned. 

We take a brief look through the series, and talk about what the future might hold after "A Dance With Dragons".

title: Australia's Role in Space Research
people: Michael Cogan, Matt Lindus, Sha Sharp
description: Space research is often seen as something which happens "Over There", in the USA, China and Russia. But Australia has a lot to offer the world. Come learn more about the part that Australia has played in space research.

title: F*** me Ray Bradbury
description:
Fanvids aren't dead! They're even more awesome!
Showing a selection of amusing and cool videos that fans have made. 

Warning: Contains mature content.

title: Stargate Retrospective
description: It's been 15 years since Stargate first graced our screens. We look back at Stargate and all its incarnations.

title: Lightsabers and Light Twirling - A Demonstration
people: Kaneda Cruz, Cathy Rye, Lisa Rye
description:
Poi is the art of twirling tethered weights in rhythmic and geometric dances. It can be done with plain weights, pretty lights or even fire. 

Rebel Empire is a Perth-based fight choreography group, specialising in lightsaber combat. 

Come along to see some of the best light-shows that Perth has to offer!

title: Brandon Sanderson - Book Signing
description:
Whether you've bought books at the con, brought your loved books from home, or want to get your convention book or other items signed, this is the time and place for it. 
Note: If you have more than five items to get signed, you may be asked to allow others with fewer items ahead first.

title: Marianne de Pierres - Book Signing
description:
Whether you've bought books at the con, brought your loved books from home, or want to get your convention book or other items signed, this is the time and place for it. 
Note: If you have more than five items to get signed, you may be asked to allow others with fewer items ahead first.

title: Art Show Tear-Down & Auction Payment
description: Dealer's room will continue to operate!

title: WASFF AGM
people: PRK , Doug Burbidge, Dave Cake, Tom Eitelhuber, Elaine Kemp, Sarah Parker, Amanda Rainey, Terri Sellen, Rohan Wallace
description:
The WASFF AGM will elect members to the Board of WASFF and the organising committee for Swancon 2014.

The full agenda is available online at http://wasff.sf.org.au/announce

title: The house that Diamond Built
description: Using nanotech to design a suburban house, from below the ground up.

title: Photographing the Apocalypse for Posterity - Part 1
description: Photography panel for fans. If you like photography or are wanting to learn more - come to this panel, be you a beginner or advanced. We have an award winning Australian Accredited Profession Photographers(AAPP) photographer and photography teacher with over 30 years of experience who will answer all of your questions. So bring lots, it should be very fun and educational!

title: Photographing the Apocalypse for Posterity - Part 2
description: Photography panel for fans. If you like photography or are wanting to learn more - come to this panel, be you a beginner or advanced. We have an award winning Australian Accredited Profession Photographers(AAPP) photographer and photography teacher with over 30 years of experience who will answer all of your questions. So bring lots, it should be very fun and educational!

title: Keeping Safe - Self Defence
description: In keeping with safe spaces this is a panel discussing self defence strategies. This will look at a some very simple techniques but will concentrate on preventative strategies associated with situation awareness, personal space, self defence mind set and fight/flight. Not a martial arts panel.

title: Dr Who's Lost Stories
description:
_The Hartnell Years_

There has been growing interest in unused Dr Who scripts, particularly in books, fan films and audio adaptations.

Join David Medlen as he looks at the 'roads not taken' in the show's formative years.

title: Real-World Based Spaceship design
people: DC Daines, Rob Masters, Andrew Williams
description:
How would spaceships actually look? Saucers? Rockets? Big blue boxes?

Hear from the experts!

title: Video Quiz
description:
For the Sixth year the Quiz is back! 

bigger, *bolder*, and badder -- join in the fun as Damian tests you with selection of film, TV and music clips!

title: 1985 - A Season of Change for Dr. Who
people: Aaron Creaser, Damian Magee, Heather Magee, Danny Oz, Colin Sharp
description:
Season 22 - conspiracies, warring factions, and grabs for power that would
forever change Doctor Who - and that was behind the scenes!

Come along as we dissect both the stories and internal politics of Colin Baker's
first full season as the Doctor.

title: Comics vs. Hollywood
people: Tom Eitelhuber, Peter Kelly, Damian Magee
description: For a long time comic book films were considered more of a niche curiosity, with only the likes of Superman and Batman breaking out to mainstream appeal. With the success of numerous franchises such as Spiderman, Hellboy, X-Men and the suite of Avengers-related films, they have become proven blockbuster material, with studios clamouring to license the next big hit. Our panel will discuss how and why things have changed, delving into some notable successes and failures along the way.

title: Animation: It's all the same now
people: Lindsay Fleay, Damian Magee, Stephen Moore
description:
Ever since Pixar became super-successful with their films and Disney became unable to make an animated blockbuster, all animated films seem to be CG and all about the hero's journey.

Our intrepid panelists lament this fact, revisit old classics and talk about what's around or coming soon that might be work a look

title: Closing Ceremony
people: PRK , Chris Creagh, Marianne De Pierres, Kathleen Griffiths, Kitty Hemsley, Brendan Ragan, Brandon Sanderson
description: Join us as we get the band back together for one last hurrah, farewell our fantastic guests, and end this apocalypse with a bang. Rumours of a group Doom Song chorus may have been exaggerated.

title: Help! My Story Is Broken!
description: Sometimes you get half way through a manuscript only to realise that t Just. Doesn't. Work. How do you reach that conclusion, and what can you do once you have?

title: "How do I write interesting dialogue?" she asked inquisitively
people: Stephen Dedman, Bevan McGuiness, Brandon Sanderson
description: All the dos and don't of crafting dialogue that is meaningful, interesting and natural.

title: The World of Parrish Plessis
description: Parrish Plessis is a wonderful series, full of action, adventure and social satire. But don't take our word for it, hear it from the author herself!

title: Renewable Sustainable Energy
people: Llew Bendsten, Chris Creagh, Elaine Walker
description: In a world with limited natural resources, we move closer to the point of resource depletion every day. One possible solution to head off, or at least defer, this apocalypse is the increasing use of Sustainable Energy, yet this faces many challenges of its own. Join our experts as they examine the future of sustainable energy?

title: SF History At Murdoch
people: Doug Burbidge, Chris Creagh, Anna Hepworth, Mike Thompson, Elaine Walker
description: Learn about the Murdoch University SF Fund, the SF collection at Murdoch and the History blog.

title: Writing Across Genres
description: Not all writers stay in the one sandbox. Some like to branch out into Sci-Fi, Fantasy, Romance, Young Adult, you name it! Hear the experts tell you how it's done.

title: 2011 in Film - Part 2
people: Tina Eitelhuber, Tom Eitelhuber, Ju Landéesse
description: 2011 delivered a bounty of genre cinema, spanning sci-fi, fantasy, comic book films, horror and more. Our panel of movie buffs will sift through the year's releases and try to separate the good from the bad and the bad from the just plain awful. Hear their verdicts and contribute your own!

title: Zombie Makeup Tutorial
description: Tina will show you how to make yourself look like one of the living dead!

title: The Entropy Crisis
description:
The entropy crisis is linked to the energy crisis and climate change at a deeper level of understanding. Every action we take increases the amount of disorder in the world. The 3 laws of thermodynamics say we can not win, break even or leave the game. 

The only thing we can do is use less of everything. In other words minimise the rate at which energy is used and therefore the rate at which entropy increases.

title: Super Mega Comics Podcast
people: Kris Bather, Chris Gorham, Kitty Hemsley, Zoe Wadsworth
description: Three Australian comics podcasts combine for the Super Mega Comics Podcast, live at Swancon.

title: Star Wars Xbox360 Kinect Launch Party
description: Come celebrate the launch of the new Star Wars Kinect bundle pack. We'll be putting it up on the projector and play the full range of Star Wars based games. So come along and see what it's about.

title: Young adults and dystopias: a love story
description:
Why is dystopic SF so popular with young readers? 
What is the appeal?

title: Auction Registration
description: Auction Registration! Prepare your items

title: Auction
description:
Come along and bid on cool and not so cool geeky stuff! Minimum bid one dollar, bids must be in dollar increments. Payment by cash at the end.

Items for auction must be registered at 6:30pm in Goldsworthy North.
 
Auction will finish at 22:00 with packdown and payment occuring in the 30 minutes following

title: Damnation & Dames Launch
people: Marianne De Pierres, Russel B Farr, Liz Grzyb
description: Ticonderoga Publications presents its latest title, Damnation & Dames, edited by Liz Grzyb and Amanda Pillar, 16 stories of paranormal noir which explore the shadows surrounding crime, showing a range of traditional noir tropes and characters, mixed up with ghosts, giant monsters, vampires, and werewolves.

title: Valve games and demos
description: Come play Valve games and demos of up coming Valve games. If you've never played any Valve games before, here is your chance to.

title: Aliens and Spaceships and Tardis', Oh My!
description: Come and decorate biscuits.

title: Stump a Scientist!
description: Why is the sky blue? Why do things fall down instead of up? What is it like to go into space? Why do birds sing? Can you stump our panel of scientists...? (Adults welcome, but children's questions get priority!)

title: String Theory/Rogue's Game
description: Get an active start to the day with these two games.

title: Story Time 1
description: Story time and quiet craft

title: Fan art/fan gallery
description: Come and watch an artist draw—and try your hand.

title: Stories in the Stars
description: Make a constellation and listen to stories about the stars.

title: Creche Rhymes
description: Nursery rhymes for the space age! (Well, with some pirates and zombies thrown in!)

title: Wand Creations
description: Ollivander's shop is closed, but here, you can make your own.

title: Emblazoning your coat of arms
description: Show people who you are! Construct a coat of arms!

title: Story Time 4
description: Story time and quiet craft

title: Fan art/fan gallery
description: Come and watch an artist draw—and try your hand.

title: Space to Scale!
description: Just how big is space? Build a (scale) model of the solar system and get a better idea!

title: Werewolves for Children
description: Can you identify the werewolves before they kill you? Game for kids.

title: Build it with papercraft!
description: A Tardis? A shuttle? A …? Come and build them out of paper, sticky tape and glue!

title: Dinosaur Stomp
description: Come and Stomp like a dinosaur or Fly like a dragon!

title: Tabletop Masquerade
description: Can your paper doll win the masquerade?

title: Storyteller Game (Let's write a book!)
description: Once Upon a Time! Come and play with the cards, then use the inspiration to write our own book! With illustrations!

title: LUNCH
description:
Nothing programmed, however the room will be open.
There will be craft material and books available.

title: Story Time 5
description: Story time and quiet craft

title: Fan art/fan gallery
description: Come and watch an artist draw—and try your hand.

title: Decode an Alien signal
description: How would you send a signal to an alien civilisation? How would you know you had received an alien signal? How would you interpret it? We'll look at examples of actual messages humans have sent and talk about the difficulties of communicating over such large distances. Then we'll decode a "signal" and see what the "aliens" are trying to tell us.

title: Book club
description: Bring along one (or two) of your favourite books (picture books/early readers/chapter books, all are welcome!), and tell us why you like it and why everyone should read it. (Parents are welcome to bring some along as well:-) )

title: Unstructured Play
description: Nothing programmed, however the room will be open.

title: Quiet Time
description: Story time and quiet craft

title: Clean Up
description: The room is closed and no activities will run. Your help to clean up and pack away everything would be appreciated.

title: Board Game Design
people: Richard Kong, Wesley Lamont, Anthony Sweet
description: Two local board game designers and an artist go through the process of designing their games.

title: Dark Shadows
description: As the New film by Tim Burton starring Jonny Depp as Barnabas Collins as 175 year old vampire coming to our screen. This panel take look at the original gothic soap opera series that introduced a vampire, a witch, a werewolf, and time travel to daytime tv.

title: Japanese Live Action of the 1960's
description:
_The Samurai_ and _The Phantom Agents_

During the early days of Australia TV two live action series from Japan arrive on our shores that cause a fuss when first screened. Which lead to other offerings from Japan, Anime and Giant Monster films. Today these are now cult favourites.

title: Live Action Versions of Anime
description: Your favourite anime as they turn into live action. As we examine some of these live action shows to compare to the anime how much justice and to the spirit of the anime. With clips from-Kenshin,Ranma,Detective Conan,You're Under Arrest, Sailor Moon and more.

title: Swancon 2013 Launch
people: Amber Boyatzis, Chris Coman, Tina Eitelhuber, Tom Eitelhuber, Chris Gorham, Stephen Griffiths, Andrew Hahn, Andrew Sharp, Zoe Wadsworth
description: The big reveal for next year's Swancon! Find out who the guests will be, and buy your membership at launch prices.

title: Pathfinders Society
description:
Welcome to Pathfinder Society Organized Play!

On Golarion, the world of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, the Pathfinder Society is an organization of explorers, vagabonds, sages, and treasure hunters determined to plumb the depths of the darkest tombs, and collect relics and lore from bygone ages. Every member shares one common dream: to contribute to the Pathfinder Chronicles, printed editions of secret lore coveted by the Society wherein only the most impressive finds and bravest exploits of the Pathfinders are immortalized.

Pathfinders are a diverse bunch of scoundrels and wanderers. Their loyalties lie on all shores of the Inner Sea, and beyond their adventures as Pathfinders, they often find themselves mixed up in the murky politics of Absalom and the nations who seek to control the City at the Center of the World from behind the scenes. The campaign centers on the sprawling city of Absalom, where factions engage in a shadow war for control of the city's politics and economy.

In Pathfinder Society Organized Play you play a member of the Pathfinder Society, seeking fortune and glory all over the face of Golarion. At the same time, your character works for one of the competing factions, all with their own motivations and secret agendas.

We will be running a mixture of short interactive demos, character creation sessions and full scenarios. Please register your interest at www.warhorn.net/perthfinder

title: Pathfinder's Society
description:
Welcome to Pathfinder Society Organized Play!

On Golarion, the world of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, the Pathfinder Society is an organization of explorers, vagabonds, sages, and treasure hunters determined to plumb the depths of the darkest tombs, and collect relics and lore from bygone ages. Every member shares one common dream: to contribute to the Pathfinder Chronicles, printed editions of secret lore coveted by the Society wherein only the most impressive finds and bravest exploits of the Pathfinders are immortalized.

We will be running a mixture of short interactive demos, character creation sessions and full scenarios. Please register your interest at www.warhorn.net/perthfinder

We will be running a mixture of short interactive demos, character creation sessions and full scenarios. Please register your interest at www.warhorn.net/perthfinder

title: Dixit
description:
Dixit is an enchanting storytelling game with the most beautiful pictures. 

Each round a player makes a statement about their card and everyone else picks one of their cards to match the statement.

Points are allocated for guessing the correct card or for tricking others.

For 3 to 6 players with a play time of 30 minutes.

title: Murder Mystery
description:
Wanted:     Eleven People

For:        The Solving of a Murder

Suspects:   All of Them

Prove your innocence, frame the guilty and find out who ripped out the last page in the book.

But watch out, because one of these people is trying to get away with murder and if yours is necessary for that goal...well.

WARNING: this game requires ELEVEN people to play and will be cancelled if not enough people sign-up

title: Arkham Horror - Learn to Play
description:
The year is 1926, and it is the height of the Roaring Twenties. Flappers dance till dawn in smoke-filled speakeasies drinking alcohol supplied by rum runners and the mob. It's a celebration to end all celebrations in the aftermath of the war to end all wars.

Yet a dark shadow grows in the city of Arkham. Alien entities known as Ancient Ones lurk in the emptiness beyond space and time, writhing at the gates between worlds. These gates have begun to open and must be closed before the Ancient Ones make our world their ruined domination.
Only a handful of investigators stand against the Arkham Horror. Will they Prevail?

Come meet Kevin, who has volunteered to teach us how to play

title: Rebel Empire Fight Choreography Workshop
description:
Learn the art of "Form Zero" used by Jedi and Sith. Learn basic Hollywood System of Fight Choreography techniques used by the pros with a Star Wars twist. All the fun and drama you've watched in the movies for years.  
There will also be a Demonstration at the beginning of the workshop by some of the REW Imperium! Places are limited and registration at the Rebel Empire Workshop Dealer Table is required prior to the workshop.

title: "The Star Crystal" Book Launch
description:
Book Launch for Author DCDaines's new Science Fiction/Fantasy book - "The Star Crystal"

He knows his destiny, lives for it, kills for it and may just die for it.

title: Race-cars, werewolves and copyright: Making transformative art
description: A presentation on the process of making a multi-media SF/F remix, along with a discussion of the gender politics, current legal debates, and the influence of other forms of adaptive art.

title: "Design a Game" Workshop
people: Bronwyn Cropley, Wesley Lamont, Anthony Sweet
description:
Ever wanted to design a game?

Then this is the workshop for you. Lets make a game and make it awesome.

title: "Going Cardboard" Screening
description:
Come and watch a sneak preview of a great Gaming documentary. Plus, the Producer may be skyping in to discuss the making of the documentary, Essen and gaming. 

Do you have fond childhood memories of gathering around the table with the family for a game of Monopoly, Scrabble, or LIFE?

Cardboard is making a comeback.

In an era of tech-based entertainment, word is spreading about a new breed of board game. Going Cardboard takes you into the designer "German-style" board gaming scene, from its community of enthusiastic fans to the creative passions of the designers and their journeys from concept to reality.

title: Kickstarting Games
description:
Kickstart is a non-profit organization that develops and markets new technologies that are bought by local entrepreneurs and used to establish new small businesses.

This includes Kickstarting games and movies, including our Saturday night screening, "Going Cardboard".

Come and see some of the games that you can Kickstart into existence, especially Mutant Meeples - dear goodness me do I want that Game!!!

title: Fun Thursday Gaming - All Evening
people: Bronwyn Cropley, Tim McDougall, Tim McDougall, Leece Smith
description:
Come and Play fun games of a variety of types. Get to know your fellow gamers; have a go at new games or old favourites and pick out a great game to invite others to play.

Including:

Falling
We Didn't Playtest This At All
No Thanks!
Treehouse 
Dixit Odyssey - we need 12 players!
Bohnanza
Hive
Army of Frogs
Fluxx of various sorts

See the Pinup Board for times and sign-up sheets

title: Fan-Created Games and Fanmade Adaptions - All Day
people: Bronwyn Cropley, Tim McDougall, Tim McDougall, Leece Smith
description:
Across Saturday, come to the Gaming Room to try out Fan-made games and fan-made expansions to existing games.

Plus, come and try out Handwritten Games's Halfling Heist and Grand City while you have the chance. 

See what Swanconners have come up with in new gaming innovations, plus a few special guests

Includes:

Glory to Rome
Miskatonic School for Girls
Plus some fine choices from Boardgame Geeks and other sources

See the Pinup Board for times and sign-up sheets

title: 4 Things to do on Sunday? Games of Doom all day long
description:
4 Things to do on Sunday? Harken to the four horses of War, Disease, Famine and of course, Death. 

Today is the Day of Doom, to celebrate, we are playing the Games of DOOM!!!

Mahahahaha!!!

Including:

Arkham Horror
Invasion from Outer Space: The Martian Game 
Ticket to Ride Europe: with Monsters Alvin and Dexter (because trains need
more monsters)
Forbidden Island
Creature that ate Sheboygan

Plus many, many more...

See the Pinup Board for times and sign-up sheets.

title: Story Time 2
description: Story time and quiet craft.

title: Board Gaming (for Kids!)
description: Discover some games you may not have played before! Ages 6+.

title: Story Time 3
description: Story time (Dragons and Fairies) and quiet craft

title: Happy Birthday Robot
description: A storytelling game in which players take turns to write the story of Robot's birthday. You never know how many words you'll have to use - and the other players in the game get to finish your sentence.

title: Story Time 6

title: Help Program Swancon 2013
description: SwanCon committees rely on the feedback and contribution of members to create the convention programme. Come along and share your ideas with next year's programming team so they can cater SwanCon 2013 to your interests. We're very keen to hear some fresh perspectives, so if you've never gotten involved in convention programming before this is a great place to start!

title: Dungeons & Dragons RPG for Beginners
description:
Ever wanted to fight a dragon, battle the Dark Hordes, steal a purse, bamboozle a troll?

Then this is the game for you.

D&D is a storytelling game where you quest for adventure or perhaps just treasure, battle deadly foes, conduct daring rescues and most of all, use your mind to solve the puzzles and mysteries that lie underneath the oh-so-innocent surface.

title: Games for the Family - 10am to 12pm
description:
An introduction to games that are great for the whole family. 

Short, simple and meaty games.

What better way to start the weekend?

title: The Resistance
description:
Leaflet Found in Secret Hiding Place:

Printed Message Reads: 
'We are the Resistance and we work for Freedom from our oppressors

So, let us meet under the guise of a "game" here in this very convention. No one will suspect that this is not as it seems. Via Va Resistance!'

Handwritten:
'Imperial Spies Unite. It is time to take down the treacherous Dogs! Let us meet that this meeting and destroy the traitors from Within. Via Va NO Resistance!'

title: Live Massively Multiplayer Text Adventure Game
description:
Parsely Games are based upon the text adventure games from the late 1970s and 1980s. 

Its like playing a computer game...except you are the character within the monitor screen.

Equipment: A whiteboard or large amount of paper

Resources: Lots and lots of players

Result: Lots and lots of fun!!!

title: Magic the Gathering Tournament
description:
Magic the Gathering is the world's most popular Card Game.

Competitive, fast moving, deeply enjoyable.

Come and Play for riches and prizes.

Novices are welcome, especially if they attend the Saturday training session

Cost: $20 to attend and afterwards you walk away with a Deck of Cards worth the same amount

No private decks, all card provided

title: Art Show Auction
description:
Any pieces of art which received more than five bids on it will be auctioned at this time.

The Dealer's room will continue to operate!

title: Free Gaming & Programmed Events - Thursday 3
description: Free gaming and programmed events up to 3am - Its all fun.

title: Battlestar Galactica
description:
After the Cylon attack on the Colonies, the battered remnants of the human race are on the run, constantly searching for the next signpost on the road to Earth. They face the threat of Cylon attack from without, and treachery and crisis from within. Humanity must work together if they are to have any hope of survival…but how can they, when any of them may, in fact, be a Cylon agent?

Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game is an exciting game of mistrust, intrigue, and the struggle for survival. Based on the epic and widely-acclaimed Sci Fi Channel series, Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game puts players in the role of one of ten of their favorite characters from the show. Each playable character has their own abilities and weaknesses, and must all work together in order for humanity to have any hope of survival. However, one or more players in every game secretly side with the Cylons. Players must attempt to expose the traitor while fuel shortages, food contaminations, and political unrest threatens to tear the fleet apart.

Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game is a semi-cooperative game for 3-6 players ages 10 and up that can be played in 2-3 hours.

title: Incan Gold Competition
description:
Escape the temple, Capture lots of treasure and artifacts.

'Nough said.

The West Australian Boardgamers have donated a copy of this game to the winner of the Competition

title: Mansions of Madness
tags: Board Game, Gaming, Role Playing Game RPG
description:
Horrific monsters and spectral presences lurk in manors, crypts, schools, monasteries, and derelict buildings near Arkham, Massachusetts. Some spin dark conspiracies while others wait for hapless victims to devour or drive insane. It’s up to a handful of brave investigators to explore these cursed places and uncover the truth about the living nightmares within.

Do you dare to enter the Mansion?

title: Lord of the Rings
description:
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game is a cooperative adventure game in which the players attempt to complete a scenario, each with three heroes of their choice and a deck of allies, events and attachments to support them. Each round, players send their heroes and allies to quest or to fight with enemies that engage them. However, as the heroes and allies exhaust after questing, defending, or attacking, the players' options are typically insufficient to deal with everything at once. Therefore, players need to determine whether it is more urgent to quest and make progress in the scenario while the enemy forces gain power, or to take down enemies while making no progress, not knowing what will come next.

The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game is the base game of a Living Card Game for which new adventure packs are released monthly. The base game contains three scenarios, twelve famous characters from the works of J.R.R. Tolkien (including

title: Fan Funds and You!
people: Dave Cake, John Parker, Sarah Parker
description:
What are Fan Funds? Who's in contention for this year's ones?

Also _What did Dave do on his holidays?_

title: Antaire: Dungeons
description:
Explore the hidden dungeons of the land of Antaire. Fight your way through the dungeon, avoiding its traps, fighting monsters and most importantly collecting your gold.

Antaire: Dungeons is a competitive dungeon exploration game. Players compete against the dungeon and each other, trying to leave with the most gold.

title: When The Stars Are Right
description: The motif of the dead civilisation or dead race is a common one in Lovecraftian horror, even the dead planet. Much of Lovecrafts work implies that our civilisation, our race, and our planet may soon join them. Why is this sense of doom such an important part of cosmic horror? What form does a Lovecraftian apocalypse take?

title: NERF!
description: Come play with NERF guns! Compete to be the crack shot of the NERF world!

title: Anime card games
description: There's a new anime card game that is spreading around the world, fast! so come over and check it out. Deck orders and booster orders will be available.

title: Pokemon TCG tournament
description: New to the Pokemon TCG? or an experienced player? then come along and play in a tournament. There are 3 categories to choose from; beginners, classic and league.

title: Pinwheels
description: Come and play with the fan GoH!

title: Horizons - Demo Game
description:
Horizons is a miniatures boardgame for 2 players. Normal runtime is up to 2 hours, but for today, you can play 1 hour demos.

Capture generators in order to take the central artifact. Then sneak it back to your base while your opponent tries to stop you. 

Fighting, racing, tactics and resource management. What more could you possibly need in a game?
